meanings.definition: The process of erosion by abrasion.
meanings.sent1: The constant corrasion of the river against the rocks smoothed them over time.
meanings.sent2: The corrasion caused by the sandpaper on the wood surface revealed a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: The playful kittens engaged in corrasion as they scratched the furniture legs.
meanings.sent4: The corrasion of time on the ancient statue made its features almost unrecognizable.
meanings.sent5: The powerful corrasion of the waves against the cliff created a stunning natural arch.

meanings.definition: The wearing away of rock by the mechanical action of other rock particles.
meanings.sent1: The slow corrasion of the river against the canyon walls formed intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: The corrasion caused by the constant wind and sand sculpted the desert rocks.
meanings.sent3: The corrasion of the kids' shoes on the gym floor made squeaky noises.
meanings.sent4: The relentless corrasion of the glacier carved deep valleys in the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The gradual corrasion of the waterfall on the rocks created a smooth cascade.
